title: Object Pronouns: me, you, him, her
description: Слушайте предложения с объектными местоимениями и определяйте их смысл.

tasks.audioText: A girl is at school. She raises her hand. The teacher always helps me.

options.text: The teacher helps the girl.
The teacher helps the boy.
The teacher helps everyone.
The teacher helps the parents.

tasks.explanation: 'Helps me' — 'me' refers to the speaker, who is the girl. Option 1 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A mother talks to her son at the door. He is leaving for school. I will call you after lunch.
tasks.transcript: I will call you after lunch.

options.text: The son will call his mother after lunch.
The mother will call the school after lunch.
The mother will call her son after lunch.
The mother will call her friend after lunch.

tasks.explanation: 'Call you' — 'you' is the son. The mother is speaking. Option 3 is correct.

tasks.audioText: Two women talk about their boss. He is in a meeting. We can ask him later.

options.text: The boss will ask them later.
They will ask each other later.
They will ask the secretary later.
They will ask the boss later.

tasks.explanation: 'Ask him' — 'him' refers to the boss. Option 4 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A boy talks about his sister. She is in the kitchen. Can you give her the salt?
tasks.transcript: Can you give her the salt?

options.text: He asks someone to give salt to the sister.
He asks someone to give salt to the mother.
He asks the sister to give salt.
He asks someone to give pepper to the sister.

tasks.explanation: 'Give her' — 'her' refers to the sister. Option 1 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A family is planning a trip. The grandmother wants to join. Please take us to the airport.
tasks.transcript: Please take us to the airport.

options.text: The family asks for a ride to the park.
The family asks for a ride to the airport.
One person asks for a ride to the airport.
The family asks to stay at home.

tasks.explanation: 'Take us' — 'us' means the whole family group. They want to go to the airport. Option 2.

tasks.audioText: A teacher talks about two students. They did well on the test. I am very proud of them.
tasks.transcript: I am very proud of them.

options.text: The teacher is proud of all students.
The teacher is proud of the two students.
The students are proud of the teacher.
The teacher is angry at the two students.

tasks.explanation: 'Proud of them' — 'them' refers to the two students. Option 2 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A man and his dog are at the park. The dog finds a stick. Bring it to me, boy!

options.text: The man wants the dog to bring the ball.
The man wants the dog to bring the stick.
The man wants the dog to sit down.
The man wants to give the stick to the dog.

tasks.explanation: 'Bring it to me' — 'it' is the stick, 'me' is the man. He wants the stick. Option 2.

tasks.audioText: A woman calls her friend on the phone. They talk about dinner. I will meet you at the restaurant.
tasks.transcript: I will meet you at the restaurant.

options.text: She will call her friend from the restaurant.
She will meet her friend at the restaurant.
Her friend will come to her house.
She will meet her friend at the office.

tasks.explanation: 'Meet you at the restaurant' — 'you' is the friend. They will meet at the restaurant. Option 2.

tasks.audioText: A boy sees a cat on the street. The cat looks lost. Let me take it home.

options.text: The boy wants to leave the cat.
The boy wants to feed the cat outside.
The boy wants to take the cat home.
The boy wants someone to take him home.

tasks.explanation: 'Take it home' — 'it' refers to the cat. The boy wants to bring the cat home. Option 3.

tasks.audioText: A nurse talks to an old man at the hospital. He needs medicine. The doctor will see him soon.
tasks.transcript: The doctor will see him soon.

options.text: The doctor will see the nurse soon.
The doctor will see the old man soon.
The old man will see the doctor tomorrow.
The doctor left the hospital.

tasks.explanation: 'See him' — 'him' refers to the old man. The doctor will see the patient. Option 2.

tasks.audioText: A man talks about his wife. She works hard every day. I always cook dinner for her.
tasks.transcript: I always cook dinner for her.

options.text: The wife cooks dinner for the man.
The man cooks dinner for his children.
The man orders dinner for his wife.
The man cooks dinner for his wife.

tasks.explanation: 'Cook dinner for her' — 'her' is the wife. The man cooks for her. Option 4.

tasks.audioText: Two friends are at a concert. The music is very loud. This song reminds me of summer.
tasks.transcript: This song reminds me of summer.

options.text: The song makes the speaker think of winter.
The song makes the speaker think of summer.
The song makes the friend think of summer.
The speaker does not like the song.

tasks.explanation: 'Reminds me of summer' — 'me' is the speaker. The song makes them think of summer. Option 2.

tasks.audioText: A girl finds a lost wallet on the street. She picks it up. I should give it to the police.
tasks.transcript: I should give it to the police.

options.text: She should give the wallet to its owner.
She should give the wallet to the police.
She should keep the wallet.
She should throw the wallet away.

tasks.explanation: 'Give it to the police' — 'it' is the wallet. She plans to hand it over. Option 2.

tasks.audioText: A coach talks to the football team. The game is tomorrow. I believe in you, team!

options.text: The team believes in the coach.
The coach believes the team will win.
The coach is angry at the team.
The coach does not trust the team.

tasks.explanation: 'Believe in you' — 'you' is the team. The coach has confidence in them. Option 2.

tasks.audioText: A mother looks at her children playing. They are in the garden. I can see them from the kitchen window.
tasks.transcript: I can see them from the kitchen window.

options.text: The children watch the mother from the garden.
The mother watches the neighbors from the window.
The mother watches the children from the kitchen.
The mother is in the garden with them.

tasks.explanation: 'See them from the kitchen window' — 'them' is the children. The mother watches from inside. Option 3.

short_description: Тренируйте понимание объектных местоимений на слух.
